intro: Borreria anderssonii, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which attract various pollinators. Borreria anderssonii is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its latex sap is milky and can be toxic, making it a plant to handle with care.
